sentences.english: My parents jack up my allowance, and I ll be maxing on cash.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母增加我的零用钱，我的现金就会很宽裕了。

sentences.english: He was not well-to-do but never tried to be financially successful.
sentences.chinese: 他经济上并不宽裕，却从不思富。

sentences.english: You were well offf yesterday, the next day you had nothing.
sentences.chinese: 昨天还家境宽裕，下一天便一无所有。

sentences.english: Secondary wire is laid in ample wirecasing , which allows easy wiring.
sentences.chinese: 二次线敷设于尺寸宽裕的线槽内，容易接线。

sentences.english: Daisy works as a fashion model and earns a comfortable living.
sentences.chinese: 黛西从事时装模特儿工作并过著宽裕的生活。

sentences.english: 'Even the oligarchs in Russia don't feel rich anymore,' he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，甚至俄罗斯的寡头们也觉得手头不宽裕了。

sentences.english: When you're already relatively well-off, more money makes less difference.
sentences.chinese: 当你手头相对宽裕，钱再多也没啥差别了。

definition: hard pressed for money/in financial straits
Fuyu county in Qiqihar 齊齊哈爾|齐齐哈尔[Qi2 qi2 ha1 er3], Heilongjiang
lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
tight (i.e. lacking money)/hard up/same as 緊巴巴|紧巴巴
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
